intro: Achudemia, commonly known as the common hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white. Achudemia species typically have palmately lobed leaves and produce capsules as their fruit. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are used in traditional medicine in some regions.
